events.title: Duel Between Alexander Hamilton and Aaron Burr
events.description: Vice President Aaron Burr fatally wounded former Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton in a duel in Weehawken, New Jersey.
events.significance: The duel ended the life of a founding father and had profound effects on American politics and Burr's career.

events.title: Start of World War I: Austria-Hungary Declares War on Serbia
events.description: Austria-Hungary declared war on Serbia, marking a key event that escalated into the outbreak of World War I.
events.significance: This declaration triggered a chain of alliances and conflicts, leading to a global war.

events.title: Independence of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
events.description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo gained independence from Belgium.
events.significance: Marked the end of colonial rule and the beginning of self-governance in the Congo.

events.title: Srebrenica Massacre Occurs During Bosnian War
events.description: Bosnian Serb forces captured the town of Srebrenica and killed more than 8,000 Bosniak men and boys in one of the worst atrocities in Europe since World War II.
events.significance: Represented a severe breach of international law and drew global attention to the conflict in Bosnia.
